outputs.output_descr:
UNV provided support to a project by UN-HABITAT aimed at supporting the Government of Haiti in developing and coordinating the implementation of the emergency plan and providing support for the return of people to safe houses and neighbourhoods. 

Four international UN Volunteers specialised in shelter and resettlement recovery and coordination, and two national UN Volunteers specialised in social mobilization supported UN-HABITAT's objective to set up ten Emergency Community and Shelter Resource Centres in the larger Port-au-Prince area in order to facilitate community-based early recovery activities 

The two national UN Volunteers strengthen the capacity of local communities to articulate their demands through the collective design of work plans, exchange of information, monitoring and evaluation. In addition, they contribute to the establishment of partnerships with Haitian institutions and NGOs working in the field of social mobilization.

project_title: UNV Support to HABITAT Community Centres in Haiti
